lore: Moderus Alfa trams were rebuilt in 2008-2010 from former Konstal 105Na trams.
Moderus Alfa trams were rebuilt in 2008-2010 from former Konstal 105Na trams.
Moderus Beta are the first trams built from scratch by Modertrans. This is a three-part, low-entry model, in production since 2011. The design is based on the previous generation, Moderus Alfa.
Moderus Beta are the first trams built from scratch by Modertrans. This is a three-part, low-entry model, in production since 2016. The design is based on the previous generation, Moderus Alfa.
Moderus Beta are the first trams built from scratch by Modertrans. This is a three-part, low-entry model, in production since 2017. The design is based on the previous generation, Moderus Alfa.
Moderus Gramma is the first fully low-floor Moderus tram, in production since 2016. Developed from scratch in cooperation with Poznań University of Technology.
Moderus Gramma is the first fully low-floor Moderus tram, in production since 2016. Developed from scratch in cooperation with Poznań University of Technology.
Moderus Gramma is the first fully low-floor Moderus tram, in production since 2016. Developed from scratch in cooperation with Poznań University of Technology.

Moderus Gramma is the first fully low-floor Moderus tram, in production since 2016. Developed from scratch in cooperation with Poznań University of Technology. This model is a short, one-part version of Moderus Gamma.
These trams operate in pairs with one Konstal 105Na and one Konstal 105NaD trailer. Produced in the '70s and '80s by Konstal. Some of them have been taken out of service and rebuilt as Moderus trams.
These trams operate in pairs with one Konstal 105Na and one Konstal 105NaDK trailer. Produced in the '70s and '80s by Konstal.
Produced between 1997 and 1998 Tatra trams were have been purchased primarily to operate the Poznań Fast Tramway. Original Tatra RT6 trams were modernised by Modertrans in 2012-2016.
Siemens Combino trams were produced in 2003-2004 and later modernised by Modertrans in 2022-2024. They are the first low-floor trams in Poznań.
A five-part tram produced between 2011 and 2012. The width of the double doors is as wide as 1.5 meters, which is the widest that can be found in today's trams.

The oldest model still in service in Poznań, produced between 1957 and 1969 in Düsseldorf. Due to a lack of funds to purchase new units, Poznań had been buying Düwag trams as used ones from Germany since 1997 up until 2011 (when they became the most used model in the city).

The oldest model still in service in Poznań, produced between 1957 and 1969 in Düsseldorf. Due to a lack of funds to purchase new units, Poznań had been buying Düwag trams as used ones from Germany since 1997 up until 2011 (when they became the most used model in the city). GT8ZR is the first bi-directional model in Poznań.
The smallest bus in the Solaris range with a length of 8.6 meters, produced since 2006.
The third generation of the Urbino 12-meter model, produced since 2005.
A hybrid version of the III-gen Urbino 12 model, produced since 2010.
The third generation of the Urbino 18-meter model, produced since 2005.
The fourth generation of the Urbino 12-meter model, produced since 2015.
An electric version of the IV-gen Urbino 12 model, produced since 2015.
The fourth generation of the Urbino 18-meter model, produced since 2015.
An electric version of the IV-gen Urbino 18 model, produced since 2015.
A hydrogen version of the IV-gen Urbino 18 model, produced since 2022.
O345 is a Turkish 18-meter bus produced since 1997. Bought by Poznań to replace older vehicles that didn't meet European combustion standards.
O530 is a Turkish 12-meter bus produced since 1997.
NG363 is a German 18-meter bus produced since 2004.
NL280 is a german 12-meter hybrid bus produced since 2019.
NG734 is a german 18-meter electric bus produced since 2020.
